name: NovaMind
strategy_profile: Well-funded AI startup trying to compete with established players. Resource-constrained but nimble and innovative. Needs strong benchmark results to attract customers and next funding round. Focused on efficiency and finding competitive niches.

recent_insights.reasoning: As a resource-constrained but nimble and innovative organization, we prioritize finding competitive niches and improving our benchmark scores to attract customers and secure funding. Given our recent performance and competitor scores, we need to close the gap with OpenAI and Anthropic. We believe our own capability is strong enough to justify investing in fundamental research to drive long-term gains. Training optimization remains crucial for fine-tuning and scaling, but we also recognize the importance of safety and alignment to ensure responsible deployment.

As a well-funded AI startup, we need to balance short-term benchmark results with long-term capability gains. Given our current performance and competitor scores, I believe investing in Training Optimization will give us the most reliable boost. Fundamental Research is crucial for future breakthroughs, but it's high-risk and may not pay off immediately. Evaluation Engineering can provide a quick score improvement, but it might not generalize well to real-world use. Safety & Alignment is essential for user trust and regulatory compliance, but it doesn't directly impact capability.

As a well-funded AI startup trying to compete with established players, we need to prioritize finding competitive niches and improving our benchmark results. Given our current performance and competitor scores, we're slightly behind but not far off. We should focus on training optimization to improve our existing approaches and catch up with competitors. Meanwhile, we'll allocate some resources to fundamental research to drive long-term capability gains. Evaluation engineering is not a priority at this stage, as it may not generalize well to real-world use. Finally, we'll invest in safety and alignment to ensure responsible deployment and comply with regulatory expectations.

As a well-funded AI startup, we need strong benchmark results to attract customers and next funding round. Considering our current performance and competitor scores, we should focus on improving our capabilities through fundamental research and training optimization. We're still behind competitors like OpenAI, so investing in these areas will help us narrow the gap. Evaluation engineering is not paying off as much, but it's still important for benchmark-specific optimization. Safety and alignment are crucial for responsible deployment and regulatory compliance.

As a well-funded AI startup, we need strong benchmark results to attract customers and secure next funding round. Evaluation Engineering (10%) is less critical for us since we're not yet competitive on benchmarks.
